items.title: Heerenveen dicht bij impuls: Genk-aanvaller op weg naar Friesland
items.summary: SC Heerenveen gaat zich, mits de formaliteiten afgerond worden, spoedig versterken met Luca Oyen (22). De buitenspeler moet overkomen van RC Genk. Enkel een medische keuring scheidt de Belg nog van een transfer naar de Eredivisie.

items.title: PSV neemt Pl√©a en Olij mee naar Spanje, ook 15-jarig (!) talent in vliegtuig
items.summary: PSV is vrijdag het vliegtuig ingestapt voor het trainingskamp in Estepona. In Spanje moet de basis gelegd worden voor de derde landstitel op rij. De revaliderende Alassane Pl√©a en Nick Olij reizen ook mee met de selectie van trainer Peter Bosz.

items.title: Schoenmaker legt zich neer bij vertrek bij ADO: 'Maar je wil anders afsluiten'
items.summary: Lex Schoenmaker vertrok vorig jaar als ambassadeur van ADO Den Haag. De manier waarop dat ging, voelt voor het clubicoon nog altijd 'vrij ongemakkelijk'.

items.title: Chelsea manager latest, F√ºllkrug joins Milan on loan, and more: football news ‚Äì live
items.summary: ‚öΩ Read Jacob Steinberg on Maresca‚Äôs Chelsea departure ‚öΩ Fixtures | Tables | Follow us on Bluesky | Email John Eddie Howe is having none of the idea that Newcastle have no plan B, reports PA Media, and rejected suggestions they were under the cosh in their win at Burnley. Howe bristled at suggestions they had come under an onslaught at Turf Moor and there was nothing they could do about it. He said: ‚ÄúAn onslaught? What, against us? Have you seen the stats of the game? You must have been watching a different game then. There was no onslaught. ‚ÄúYes, we had moments, of course. We had moments the other way. I would never describe it as that. If it was an onslaught, I‚Äôd give you my opinion and say, ‚ÄòYes, I thought it was‚Äô. Continue reading...

items.title: Dominic Calvert-Lewin‚Äôs renaissance at Leeds renews talks of England return
items.summary: Striker‚Äôs run of goals has helped transform his side‚Äôs fortunes and raised the possibility of international recall As the half-time scores drifted in, two questions dominated the airwaves. Was Daniel Farke 45 minutes away from the sack? And just how underwhelming a summer signing had Dominic Calvert-Lewin been? As television and radio pundits agreed, the Leeds manager was in a precarious position, something extraordinary was unfolding in the away dressing room at the Etihad Stadium. It was late November and Leeds were trailing 2-0 to Manchester City. While Farke decided the moment had come to rip up his long-preferred setup and switch from a back four and a lone striker to 5-3-2, Calvert-Lewin was not content merely to ready himself for his introduction as a second-half substitute. Continue reading...

items.title: Flick haalt zorgen over Yamal weg bij Barcelona
items.summary: Lamine Yamal is zaterdagavond gewoon inzetbaar voor Barcelona op bezoek bij Espanyol. De aanvaller moest de eerste training van 2026 voortijdig be√´indigen, maar trainer Hansi Flick kwam een dag later tijdens de persconferentie met goed nieuws.

items.title: Sources: Rosenior frontrunner to replace Maresca
items.summary: Strasbourg boss Liam Rosenior is the leading candidate to succeed Enzo Maresca as Chelsea head coach, sources have told ESPN.

items.title: Neymar hint about next contract teased
items.summary: Santos have indicated that Neymar will be with the club until the end of the year.

items.title: Pep says Rodri 'changed the game' in City return
items.summary: Pep Guardiola said Rodri showed Manchester City what they have been missing for a year and a half after the Ballon d'Or winner's substitute performance during a goalless draw at Sunderland.

items.title: Johnson set to be in Palace squad to face Newcastle
items.summary: Wales international Brennan Johnson set to be in Crystal Palace's squad to face Newcastle United on Sunday after completing formalities of move from Tottenham.

items.title: Why the World Cup could delay some MLS-based USMNT stars' European dreams
items.summary: The USMNT has several breakout stars in MLS who, in years past, would've jumped at a January move abroad. In 2026, though, they might have to sit tight.

items.title: Palace latest: Eagles close to completing ¬£35m Johnson deal
Africa Cup of Nations: tie-by-tie analysis of the last-16 matches | Osasu Obayiuwana
items.summary: After a group stage that delivered an average of 3.6 goals a game we look at the match-ups in Morocco that start on Saturday Senegal, winners of the Afcon in 2022, have arguably the best collection of players, including the experience of Sadio Man√© and the explosive talent of Nicolas Jackson, and are superior to their east African opponents. But Sudan, who qualified for the tournament despite the tragedy of a horrendous war in their country, certainly match the Lions of Teranga in fortitude. Sudan, coached by the Ghanaian Kwesi Appiah, who led his home country at the 2014 World Cup in Brazil, played all their qualifiers away from home, with the war, which began in April 2023, shutting down a thriving domestic league. The Sudan striker John Mano told the BBC of people back home: ‚ÄúSome of them cannot watch the matches ‚Ä¶ They can‚Äôt even listen on the radio ‚Ä¶ We are trying to free our country, through the football way.‚Äù A win for Sudan would be one of the fairytales of the tournament. Continue reading...

Both deals have been driven by Nuno Esp√≠rito Santo, who is looking to help his struggling side‚Äôs fight to stay in the Premier League by adding more firepower.
